description: Data, facts or figures about an individual; the set of relevant items would depend on the use case. In FAIR Genomes: Personal. In RD3: Subjects.
profiles: Beacon v2, FAIR Genomes, RD3, JRC-CDE, GDI T8.2 union, DCAT examples

description: A unique proper name or character sequence that identifies this particular person. In Beacon v2: id, in FAIR Genomes: PersonalIdentifier. In RD3: subjectID. In JRC-CDE: Pseudonym
profiles: Beacon v2, FAIR Genomes, RD3, JRC-CDE, DCAT examples

description: Addition for EJP-RD Virtual Platform API. E.g. Adult 18-65 Years Old
The year in which this person was born.
profiles: FAIR Genomes, GDI T8.2 union, RD3

description: The month in which this person was born.
profiles: FAIR Genomes, GDI T8.2 union, RD3

description: The year in which a person was born. In JRC-CDE: Date of birth
Addition for EJP-RD Virtual Platform API. E.g. TTN. In JRC-CDE: Genetic diagnosis

Consent given by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a study, examination or analysis after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
NON-STANDARD FIELD. E.g. Var001_CLD01
Assessment of patient condition in data collected on an individual patient or group of patients.

Assigned gender is one's gender which was assigned at birth, typically by a medical and/or legal organization, and then later registered with other organizations. Such a designation is typically based off of the superficial appearance of external genitalia present at birth. In RD3: sex1. In JRC-CDE: Sex
profiles: FAIR Genomes, RD3, JRC-CDE, GDI T8.2 union

description: A person's concept of self as being male and masculine or female and feminine, or ambivalent, based in part on physical characteristics, parental responses, and psychological and social pressures. It is the internal experience of gender role. For practical reasons the lookups are limited to first and second-level entries, but can be expanded when needed. Note that 'Gender at birth', 'Genotypic sex' and any (gender-related) hormone therapies in 'Medication' are usually medically more relevant than this term.
The gender of a person used for administrative purposes
A biological sex quality inhering in an individual based upon genotypic composition of sex chromosomes.
Country of residence at enrollment.
Population category defined using ancestry informative markers (AIMs) based on genetic/genomic data.
The country that this person was born in.
An indicator that provides information on the current health status of this person. In JRC-CDE: Patient's status
No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.
A coded value specifying why the subject is removed from a study.A coded value specifying why the subject is removed from a study.
The age at which death occurred. In JRC-CDE: Date of death
One or more associations between the individual and a organisation or institution.

columnName: CHECK NULL FLAVORS resources in other institutes
description: Material or data related to this person that is not captured by this system though known to be available in other institutes such as biobanks or hospitals. In JRC-CDE: Link to a biobank
Reference to the study or studies in which this person participates.
Pedigree studies in which the individual is part of.
Reference to the dataset or datasets in which this person was assigned to.
A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.
